data.name: Paradise Valley Grapefruit Ale
data.description: It’s our own slice of paradise. It’s a summer blonde with a twist – literally. You see, we’ve added plenty of dried grapefruit rind along with Sterling and Willamette hops. The result is a refreshing grapefruit aromatic with a clean citrus finish. It’s the perfect patio beer for summer.
data.foodPairings:
• Asian dishes
• Curries
• A hot summer afternoon!

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with fruit, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Whistler Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in Whistler, British Columbia this brewery has a solid rotation of beers consisting of :
Black Tusk Ale, Whiskey Jack Ale, Bear Paw Honey Lager, Powder Mountain Lager and Lost Lake IPA. As well as frequent seasonal offerings.

breweries.name: White Birch Brewing
breweries.description: Founded in 2009, White Birch Brewing has been consistently dedicated to the creation of thoughtful, heartfelt ales for the fun loving beer drinker. Providing beers that range from historical, to contemporary, to the avant-garde, each batch of beer is carefully brewed by hand, and left unfiltered for an exceptional depth of flavor.

breweries.name: Buckeye Brewing Company
breweries.description: Buckeye Brewing began brewing in 1997. The flagship beer, Hippie IPA, was first bottled in 1998. We are one of only three breweries bottling in Cleveland, OH. While well known for hoppy Pale and IPA, other styles shine as well. Buckeye produces everything from German-style Kolsch to Belgian-style Saison. Buckeye’s bottled products can be found in quality bottle shops across Ohio. Buckeye currently brews on a 15 barrel Century brew house. Stay tuned for updates on our front page.

data.name: Peach Ale
data.description: A light fruit beer with strong peach aroma, but not an overpowering peach flavor – great on a warm day. We chose peach because, believe it or not, peaches can thrive in Arizona and the flavor is very compatible with beer. Our peach ale has a subtle sweet flavor and aroma, while maintaining a light body and color.

breweries.name: Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse
breweries.description:
Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse opened in 2001 on Cross St. in the historic neighborhood of Federal Hill in Baltimore.  It immediately became a hit with neighborhood residents, suburbanites, and tourists alike.

Pub Dog quickly became famous for our gourmet personal-sized thin-crust pizzas, fresh salads, and "Dog Deal" beers - 2 mugs of our own house craft beer for one low price all the time.  

We developed a loyal late night following by serving food every night until 1:30 and staying open until 2:00AM every night.

Pub Dog expanded outside of the city in 2007, opening a location in Columbia.

Pub Dog began bottling some of our house beers for sale to go in 2007.  The bottles are now available at both pubs and in liquor stores around the state.

breweries.name: Mother's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Mother's is a growing family that's all about heady craft beers. So we started our own brewery, and we're producing as much love per barrel as we possibly can. In the short time that we've been open, we've made a helluva lot of different, fun, and innovative beers. Stop by and see what we brought with us. Cheers!

data.name: Peach Grand Cru
data.description: Peach Grand Cru is Great Divide’s newest limited offering.  Brewed with Colorado fruit picked right at the peak of ripeness, this Belgian-style ale marries two of our home state’s well-known offerings: great beer and fresh Palisade peaches.  Both sophisticated and balanced, this extraordinary, aromatic ale was born to be savored beyond the orchard.

breweries.name: Great Divide Brewing Company
breweries.description:
These beers have landed an impressive amount of acclaim: Great Divide beers have earned 18 Great American Beer Festival medals and 5 World Beer Cup awards. Great Divide was also ranked 8th in Ratebeer.com’s 2010 “The Best Brewers in the World” and was ranked 7th in Beer Advocate’s 2009 “All-Time Top Breweries on Planet Earth.”

But why take their word for it? Crack open a bottle and decide for yourself.

data.name: Peach Nouveau
data.description: Light, crisp gluten free ale brewed using honey, sorghum, and quinoa and infused with peaches.

breweries.name: Ruddy Duck Brewery and Grill
breweries.description:
Our philosophy is simple:
Create a fun and exciting atmosphere
Serve authentic made from scratch food
Provide gracious and hospitable service
Deliver it all at a great value

To guarantee excellence we buy the highest quality ingredients and prepare them to bring out the best flavors in every dish. Our chicken wings are cooked fresh daily to ensure our signature taste. Fresh and never frozen chicken breast, pork, mahi and salmon are delivered daily.

We buy only grass fed "all natural" steaks and hamburgers to ensure the highest quality. We support local farmers by purchasing our seafood and produce locally whenever available. Our desserts, pizza dough, and house specialty "Chipas" are made daily from scratch as are all our sauces, dressings and soups.

We promote friendly, unobtrusive service delivered with a smile. Most important to us is you, our guests. We strive to be a neighborhood restaurant where families with children, professionals on business, or couples out on a date can all feel welcome and comfortable.

data.name: Peach Wheat
data.description: An American Wheat beer brewed with 40% malted wheat. This beer starts sweet, but finishes with a refreshingly tart smack.

breweries.name: Half Full Brewery
breweries.description:
The Half Full Brewery is a “lifestyle” brewery and the concept behind our brewery is as simple as its name and motto sounds:  whether your glass is literally or figuratively “Half Full”, you can “look forward to more…”   What makes Half Full different is the “…” because that ellipsis is unique to you.  It can be anything in the world and most often, it has something to do with what drives you, your passion.  For me, it is very simple — I always look forward to more of my dream, Half Full, and spending time with the people that have inspired me to take this journey.  Passionate beer and passionate people, is there any better pairing?

What’s your “…”?  If you don’t know, then it’s time to step back like I did four years ago (story to follow in the near future), have a beer with a friend, and figure it out because life doesn’t get any more rewarding and exhilarating than when you pursue what you are most passionate about, when you pursue your “…”

breweries.name: I & I Brewing
breweries.description:
We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.
 
One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

data.name: Peachicot Blonde Ale
data.description: River Company’s Peachicot Blonde Ale is a light and fruity blonde ale brewed with a 2 Row Brewers Malt, Dextrine malt, a hint of corn, and peach and apricot flavors. Light and refreshing without being overly sweet, it is the perfect summer day beer. We called it Peachicot because Aprieach sounded stupid!

breweries.name: River Company Brewery
breweries.description:
River Company Brewery is located in beautiful Fairlawn, VA and are mere minutes away from Radford University and Virginia Tech.

Our restaurant specializes in all natural beef which we dry age in house to produce a distinctly tender and flavorful steak. We have a wide range of flavors on our menu and feature nightly specials.

Our Chief Brewer produces all our draft beers in house, offering a wide variety of flavors to please every palate.

data.description: A beautiful red ale with the aroma of fresh peaches.  Caramel malty sweetness is balanced by moderate hop notes, which are then followed by a sweet blend of peaches and pumpkin.  Always lady brewed!

breweries.name: Kokopelli Beer Company
breweries.description: Kokopelli Beer Company is a small brewpub located in the Solaire Shoppes at 8931 Harlan Street in Westminster Colorado, just across from the future Westminster Mall renovation. We enjoy brewing quality handcrafted ales and meeting new folks, so we decided to put them together. As a brew pub, we offer a small menu to compliment our ales with items such as pizzas, sandwiches, salads and more.

breweries.name: Terrapin Beer Company
breweries.description:
Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.

Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

data.name: Pear Ginger Beer - Lips of Faith
data.nameDisplay: Pear Ginger Beer - Lips of Faith
data.description: Mix your own adventure this summer with PEAR GINGER BEER . Our latest Lips of Faith release updates the Victorian-era ginger beer with whimsical additions of pear and lemon peel, creating a zesty, invigorating summer sipper crafted for beer glasses and mixologists’ cocktail shakers alike. Warming, spicy ginger punctuates a lively wash of sunny lemon, pear and bready white wheat for a sip that starts sweet, but finishes with just the right amount of heat. Drink it straight, no chaser, or put a new spin on a classic gimlet—either way, shake it up this season with Pear Ginger Beer.

breweries.name: New Belgium Brewing
breweries.description: We'll set the scene: 1989. Belgium. Boy on bike. (OK, make that a young man of 32). As our aspiring young homebrewer rides his mountain bike with fat tires through European villages famous for beer, New Belgium Brewing Company was but a glimmer in his eye. Or basement. For Jeff Lebesch would return to Fort Collins with a handful of ingredients and an imagination full of recipes. And then there was beer. Jeff's first two basement-brewed creations? A brown dubbel with earthy undertones named Abbey and a remarkably well-balanced amber he named Fat Tire. To say the rest was history would be to overlook his wife's involvement. Kim Jordan was New Belgium's first bottler, sales rep, distributor, marketer and financial planner. And now, she's our CEO.

data.description: This light-bodied lager is a beautiful straw color and has a smooth finish.  Delicious and thirst-quenching - an easy drinking beer perfect for anytime!

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with fruit, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company
breweries.description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

locations.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company - Outpost
locations.hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday open 1pm - 7pm.  Friday & Saturday open 1pm - 8pm.  Sunday open 1pm - 6pm

data.name: Perch Glca (Grilled Lemon Cream Ale)
data.description: Adding lemon to a beer is done every day. Adding grilled lemons gives the beer a smoky, caramel sweet lemon finish in a cream ale base. A great summer beer and a favorite among beer lovers and non-beer drinkers alike!

breweries.name: The Perch Pub & Brewery
breweries.description: The Perch is something you have to see to believe. With panoramic views of Downtown Chandler on our roof top bar or our lush garden landscape in our courtyard that hosts over 90 tropical rescue birds. We have the most unique and breathtaking setting, and we feature 40 beers on tap, including our very own  house brews, and a full menu of beer-infused food created by our chef and his team of culinary masterminds. Anytime is the perfect time to treat yourself to an unforgettable experience at The Perch.

data.description: A harmonious marriage of fruit and beer. Distinctively fruity

data.description: Raspberry Blonde: saving marriages since September of 2012. A light, crisp, and sweet fruit beer with a wet kiss of raspberries.

breweries.name: Perrin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located 10 minutes north of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan, our micro brewery and taproom is striving to bring a world class experience to every person who walks through our doors.

With a hospitality philosophy of treating our customers like they're guests in our home, we look forward to serving you.

data.name: Persimmon Ale
data.description: Creamy, elegant, silky, with a blend of fruity and spicy cideriness. This does not taste like pie spice like so many fruit beers, because it is brewed with pounds and pounds of fresh Fuyu and Hachiya persimmons. An autumnal delight.

breweries.name: Solarc Brewing
breweries.description: Solarc Brewing is a craft beer co. based out of Los Angeles CA.  Started by two avant-garde artists and crafty tinkerers Archie Carey and Saul Alpert Abrams make small batch specialty beers that experiment with alternative ingredients while still keeping a well balanced strong drinkable brew.

data.name: Pete's Wicked Strawberry Blonde
data.description:
Pete's Wicked Strawberry Blonde is truly a unique beer experience. Reward yourself with our golden lager made of the finest pale and wheat malts and Cluster Hops, with a kiss of natural strawberry flavor.

Availability ceased with the entire Pete's line in spring 2011.

breweries.name: Pete's Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded by homebrewer Pete Slosberg and Mark Bronder in 1986, helping to pioneer the craft beer movement.

Exclusively brewed under contract by Matt Brewing Company of Utica, NY, best known for their Saranac line.

Sold to the Gambrinus Company in 1998.

Sadly, ceased production in spring 2011 after declining sales under Gambrinus ownership.

breweries.name: 10 Barrel Brewing Company
breweries.description: We started back in 2006 with three guys and one simple vision.. brew beer, drink beer and have fun doing it. Since then we have grown but our focus will always stay the same... Rough morning? Grab a beer. Powder day? The "gone skiing" sign goes up. Too hot to work? Mandatory company float. You get the picture... here's to living it up with a beer in hand!

data.name: Pineapple Paradise Cream Ale
data.description: Summer is now on tap!  Our award winning Cream Ale is infused with Pineapple, giving this light bodied beer a tropical twist!  This beer is absolutely refreshing.  Close your eyes.  You’re in the tropics…and you’re welcome

data.name: Pink Killer
data.description: Fruity and thirst-quenching, sweet yet not sickly, Pink Killer is a beer based on malt, wheat and pink grapefruit, which explains its very unique colour and the hint of bitterness typical of this fruit, in turn quenching the biggest of thirsts with a flavoursome taste.

breweries.name: Mountain Town Station Brew Pub
breweries.description:
Mountain Town Station proudly serves central Michigan the highest quality hand crafted brews made from specially selected hops and organic grains. With seven distinctive beers available including seasonal specialty draughts, the brewery is an essential stop on the road to Mount Pleasant. 

Stop in and try a sampler platter of six beers, one cool pint, or take one of our brews home in a half gallon growler or even a keg of your favorite flavor. Mountain Town Station, central Michigan's premiere brewery and steakhouse.

data.name: plechovka Radler Citrón-Baza-Mäta
data.description: Klasická sviežosť obľúbeného Bažant Radlera umocnená jemne chladivým efektom mäty. Originalitu nového produktu podčiarkuje tradičná, na Slovensku obľúbená chuť bazy s použitím čisto prírodných ingrediencií.

data.name: plechovka Radler Grapefruit
data.description:
Spojením originálneho slovenského piva Zlatý Bažant s prírodnou grapefruitovou limonádou vzniká jedinečný osviežujúci Bažant Radler Grapefruit. Kombinácia horkej chuti piva a sviežej horkosti grapefruitu je osviežujúcou voľbou plnej jedinečnej chuti.

 Je vyrobený z čisto prírodných ingrediencií, neobsahuje žiadne konzervanty, ani farbivá.

breweries.name: Bootlegger's Brewery
breweries.description: Bootlegger's Brewery is a local microbrewery located in Fullerton, California. We are a small artisian brewery established with the mission of providing fresh and unique craft beer to the local community and beyond. Our unique small batch process makes us one of the most flexible breweries in Southern California. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver a wide variety of styles and flavors in our beer with the highest level of quality.

data.name: Pomegranate Date Ale
data.description: A native Israeli ale featuring three of the seven species - pomegranate, date, and barley - for a beer experience of Biblical proportion.

breweries.name: Sycamore Brewing
breweries.description:
We have proud roots in home brewing and North Carolina, and we have been humbly perfecting some of our favorite recipes over the last 10 years.  We are incredibly excited to share them in the months to come.  Justin was born and raised here in Charlotte, and we couldn’t be happier for our brewery to become part of the city's dynamic and growing craft beer scene.  

If you love good beer as much as we do, we can't wait to have you join us in the taproom for a pint or two.  It's not long until we're pouring.

breweries.name: Rocket Republic Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are located in Madison, Alabama!

data.name: Power of Love
data.description: Power of love is a truly unique pink colored Shandy created by blending Northwoods Gourmet Lemonade and a Wheat Ale brewed with raspberry and rosemary.  Enticing sugary aromas intermix with appealing citrus and herb fragrances.  Very sweet lemon flavors give way to a shock of tart raspberry before turning sharply dry, as if eating a piece of grapefruit.  The finish is somewhat bitter and spicy, but quite satisfying.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. breweries.name: Short's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.

breweries.name: Spoetzl Brewery
breweries.description: Spoetzl was founded in 1909, and claims to be the oldest independent brewery in Texas. A group of businessmen incorporated Shiner Brewing Association and placed Herman Weiss in as the company's first brewmaster. In 1914 a German immigrant brewer named Kosmas (or Kosmos) Spoetzl co-leased with Oswald Petzold with an option to buy in 1915. Spoetzl had attended brewmaster's school and apprenticed for three years in Germany, worked for eight years at the Pyramids Brewery in Cairo, Egypt, and then worked in Canada. He moved to San Antonio in search of a better climate for his health, bringing with him a family recipe for a Bavarian beer made from malted barley and hops.

data.name: Prickly Pear Radler
data.description: The perfect hot weather beverage!! This radler is a 50-50 blend of our Kolsch and fruit soda to create a refreshing light and crisp drink. This pint pours a pale yellow color with a fading white head. Radler has a refreshing lemony or lime aroma with a nicely balanced light body with a tart finish.

breweries.name: Block 15 Brewing Company
breweries.description: We brew with the finest organic base malt, in combination with top quality imported specialty malts and Northwest grown hops. On tap you will find at least 12, sometimes up to 14 of our own brews representing a fine spectrum of beer styles. On average we have a new beer on tap every 1-2 weeks, recreating classic styles and developing our own unique brews as well.

data.name: Prunus
data.description: Prunus (from the cherry's bothanical name, Prunus Avium or Cerasus according to variety) is made adding to our spelt beer Duchessa about 20% of fresh cherries with their stones. Differently from the typical Belgian kriek, it is not too sour as it keeps some of the Duchessa's smoothness. Yet it's not sugary indeed, thanks to the well balanced bitter aftertaste.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with fruit, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Moccasin Bend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Moccasin Bend Brewing Company is located in the historic St. Elmo district of Chattanooga, TN.  We’re at the foot of Lookout Mountain just steps away from the world-famous Incline Railway and very near to the great Moccasin Bend of the Tennessee River. 

MBBC was started by two brewers whose quest for the perfect beer led them to learn the art of brewing.  Chris Hunt and Duncan Guy began their brewing education in the Barley Mob Brewers homebrewing club and continued to search for unique and distinctive ale and lager formulas. They decided to offer their creations to the public through a small batch microbrewery in 2006.  Soon thereafter, award-winning brewer Courtney Tyvand joined the two and presented his smoked porter at the brewery’s first beer dinner in October of 2006.

The brewery is located on the ground floor of a historic building at 4015 Tennessee Avenue in St. Elmo.  The building is constructed of foot-square cedar timbers and two-foot thick walls made of granite stone and mortar.  Built in 1911 as a packaging factory for K-Rations for WWI, we occasionally find artifacts from that era in the building walls and ceiling.  The brewery shares space with the Chattanooga U-Brew, a brew-on-premises business owned by Greg McCort. 

MBBC is proud to offer small batch specialty ales and lagers in kegs of various sizes.  A tasting room is part of the brewery; samples of our beers can be tasted and tested on premises.  Occasionally we have tasting events or tapping events at the brewery or at a nearby bar or restaurant.  Please check our calendar for scheduled tasting events at the brewery.

data.name: PYNK
data.description: Yards proudly donates $1 from every case sold to breast cancer research and awareness.  So when you drink PYNK, you are helping us do more good. Cheers to that! Yards PYNK is a beer like no other. We add 3,300 pounds of sour and sweet cherries and raspberries to each batch, resulting in a tart berry ale that’s effervescent and pleasantly pink in color. Delighting the palette, this light-bodied brew finishes refreshingly dry. ALE BREWED WITH CHERRY AND RASPBERRY

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. breweries.name: Yards Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In 1988, two cash-strapped collegiate wrestlers realized that they could sustain their thirst for quality beer without spending their modest savings at the local liquor store by brewing beer themselves. So began the friendship of Tom Kehoe and Jon Bovit.

As they made their way through college they continued to experiment with homebrewing and formulating new recipes. Proud of their product, they were eager to share it with friends. An instant favorite, it wasn't long until they realized their modest homebrewing operation wasn't going to be enough to satisfy the growing demand.

During the early 1990s, many breweries opened, and craft brewing started to gain popularity. Working in a small English-style brewery in Western Maryland, Tom Kehoe and Jon Bovit decided to take matters into their own hands, and in 1994, they founded Yards Brewing Company.
